title: YouTuber wife, lover kill husband in Haryana, dump body in drain
content: In Haryana's Bhiwani district, a YouTuber named Ravina and her lover allegedly murdered her husband, Praveen, after he discovered their affair. They transported his body on a bike and dumped it in a drain. Ravina confessed to the crime after police reviewed CCTV footage showing her and a man with a body on a bike. Police are searching for the absconding lover, Suresh.

title: 'I'm almost like an activist now': Robert Vadra appears before ED over land deal
content: Businessman Robert Vadra faced a second day of questioning by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) regarding a Haryana land deal. Vadra criticized the government, alleging misuse of central agencies to target those exposing its wrongdoings and creating division. He asserted his role as a voice for the people, hinting at a potential entry into politics.

title: ‘Harem drama’: How Elon Musk manages ‘legion' of babies, their moms
content: Elon Musk, driven by concerns over declining birth rates, has fathered at least 14 children with multiple women, aiming to boost the global population. A Wall Street Journal investigation reveals his efforts to secretly expand his family, including offering sperm and using surrogates.

title: Zaheer Khan blessed with baby boy; wife Sagarika shares first pic
content: Former cricketer Zaheer Khan and actress Sagarika Ghatge have welcomed their first child, a baby boy named Fatehsinh Khan. The couple shared the happy news in a joint social media post, expressing love and gratitude. Fans and celebrities flooded the comments with warm wishes, celebrating the arrival of the newest member of the Khan-Ghatge family.

title: Salesforce CEO remembers 'life lesson' that his Indian Guru taught him
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff credits his 1996-97 India trip to meet Guru Mata Amritanandamayi in Kerala as the genesis of Salesforce. During the visit, while explaining his vision, Mata Amritanandamayi emphasized the importance of giving back. This profoundly influenced Benioff, shaping Salesforce's philanthropic ethos and his personal belief in being kind to others.

title: Indian carriers may gain from China's action against Boeing
content: Indian carriers like Air India Express and Akasa may benefit from China's directive to its airlines to avoid Boeing aircraft due to US tariffs. This could lead to the redirection of Boeing 737 MAX and 787 Dreamliners, originally intended for Chinese airlines, to Indian carriers, potentially easing their aircraft acquisition challenges.

title: Watch: Preity Zinta breaks the internet with wild celebration
content: Preity Zinta's exuberant celebration became an instant internet sensation after Punjab Kings achieved a historic upset, defending a meager total of 111 against Kolkata Knight Riders. Her unrestrained joy, captured on camera, resonated with fans as PBKS bowlers orchestrated a remarkable turnaround. This victory marked the lowest total ever defended in IPL history, surpassing Chennai Super Kings' previous record.

title: 'Hatched criminal conspiracy in 2010': Congress loan to AJL forms basis of ED Herald case
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a chargesheet against Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi concerning the National Herald case. This action follows the ED's recent initiation of proceedings to seize properties valued at over Rs 700 crore belonging to the Associated Journals Limited (AJL), a company with ties to both leaders.

title: Trump is 'escalating' the Harvard University fight; Musk 'joins in' and picks side
content: A clash has erupted between Donald Trump and Harvard University over governance, hiring, and admissions, including demands to shut diversity offices. After Harvard rejected these demands, citing constitutional rights, the White House froze $2.2 billion in federal funding. Elon Musk has weighed in, supporting Trump's call to revoke Harvard's tax-exempt status.

title: 'Asambhav': RJ Mahvash's post for Yuzi Chahal goes viral
content: Yuzvendra Chahal's exceptional spin bowling led Punjab Kings to a stunning victory over Kolkata Knight Riders in a low-scoring thriller. Chahal's match-winning 4/28, achieved despite a shoulder niggle, turned the game around after PBKS defended a mere 111 runs. His performance propelled him to the top of the IPL wicket-takers list with 211 scalps.

title: Suruchi stuns Manu Bhaker for consecutive golds at ISSF World Cup
content: India began their ISSF World Cup campaign in Lima impressively, securing medals across all categories on the first day. Suruchi Singh clinched gold in the Women’s 10m Air Pistol, with Manu Bhaker taking silver. Saurabh Chaudhary secured a bronze in the Men’s 10m Air Pistol, marking a successful return to individual ISSF medals after two years.

title: Redmi A5 with 5,200 mAh battery and 32MP camera launched: Price, offers and more
content: Xiaomi has launched the Redmi A5 in India, an entry-level smartphone featuring a 6.88-inch HD+ display with a 120Hz refresh rate and powered by a Unisoc T7250 chipset. Available in two variants, it offers up to 4GB RAM and 128GB storage, expandable to 2TB.

title: 'Airfare, stipend': How Trump administration plans to help you self deport
content: President Trump announced a "self-deportation program" offering financial incentives and plane tickets for illegal immigrants to leave the US, prioritizing the removal of criminals. The administration aims to retain "good" immigrants, potentially assisting them in returning legally.

title: IPL: Mayank Yadav to undergo fitness test before LSG's next game
content: Pace bowler Mayank Yadav has rejoined Lucknow Super Giants after recovering from back and toe injuries at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence. He will undergo fitness tests before potentially playing against Rajasthan Royals. LSG will proceed cautiously, given Yadav's history of stress fractures, aiming to strengthen their seam attack, currently led by Shardul Thakur.

title: SC fixes May 14 for hearing pleas against appointment of CEC, ECs under 2023 law
content: Justice Kant told Mr. Bhushan that the court will take up the matter on May 14 by cancelling a special Bench matter on the said date

title: IIT-Bombay graduate launches free website to make ancient Sanskrit literature accessible to all
content: With the launch of SanskritSahitya.org, Antariksh Bothale, a software engineer and an IIT Bombay graduate is making ancient Sanskrit texts accessible and appealing to the new generation using modern computational tools.

title: Haryana land deal case: Robert Vadra appears before ED on day 2
content: Robert Vadra was questioned for about five hours on Tuesday and his statement was recorded by the federal probe agency under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), official sources said

title: India calls out attempts to introduce new parameters such as religion, faith as basis for representation in reformed UNSC
content: India’s Permanent Representative to the UN Ambassador P. Harish told the IGN meeting that those opposed to text-based negotiations do not seek progress on UNSC reforms

title: One killed, over 20 injured as bus carrying Sabarimala pilgrims from Karnataka overturns in Kerala
content: Highway in which the accident occurred has sharp bends and a steep incline and while navigating it, the bus went out of control and overturned onto the side of the road, said a police officer

title: Vincy Aloshious accuses co-star of drug use and misbehaviour on malayalam film set
content: The ‘Rekha’ star, who recently attended an anti-drug awareness event, has since been making headlines for stating she would not act in films with drug-using actors

title: Arvind Panagariya to meet Chandrababu Naidu today
content: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu will be making a presentation to the Finance Commission on the State finances

title: PwC exits more than a dozen countries to avoid scandals: report
content: Local leaders at the firm said they lost over a third of their business in recent years after pressure from PwC's global executives to drop risky clients, according to the report

title: Kerala Youtuber taken into custody for pointing ‘gun’ at bus staff, released
content: Youtuber, known as Thoppi, was released as the weapon was found to be an air gun which is not included in the category of licensed arms, say police

title: Army concludes high-altitude expedition in Sikkim
content: A team of 20 personnel covered 146 km of rugged trails and steep gradients in 28 days, including acclimatisation

title: Waqf Bill Supreme Court hearing LIVE updates: Pleas to be heard by the Bench today
content: A three-Judge Bench comprising Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna and Justices Sanjay Kumar and K.V. Viswanathan, so far, listed 10 petitions on the issue

title: Markets trade flat after two days of sharp rally amid sluggish global trends
content: After two days of sharp rally, the 30-share BSE benchmark Sensex declined 165.3 points to 76,569.59 in early trade. The NSE Nifty dipped 51.55 points to 23,277

title: Ex-MLA Shahnawaz Rana, son among five booked under Gangsters Act
content: According to police, the accused were involved in evading GST by operating fake companies. Additionally, Shahnawaz Rana, who is currently lodged in the district jail, is alleged to have used a mobile phone illegally from within the prison.

title: Study finds high-altitude winds and dry soil conditions caused heatwaves in 2022
content: A study published on April 8, 2025, by researchers from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Bombay and Johannes Gutenberg-University Mainz, Germany, has uncovered why South Asian countries experienced back-to-back extreme heat events in early spring of 2022.

title: Akhilesh accused CM Adityanath govt of indulging in large-scale mining in Chambal ravines
content: Akhilesh Yadav questioned whether the small and large hills near the historic Sumer Singh Fort had been "transferred" to regions like Basti and Gorakhpur in collusion with lower and higher-ranking officials

title: 'Nothing to hide': Robert Vadra after ED questioning in Haryana land deal
content: Businessman Robert Vadra faced questioning by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) regarding the Gurugram land case. He asserted his belief in the truth and readiness to face pressure, alleging the inquiry was politically motivated and aimed to distract from key issues. Vadra claimed the ED action was disrupting his charitable work and vowed to continue speaking against injustice.

title: 'Reject heavy-handed orchestration': Columbia clarifies stand amid Trump’s crackdown
content: Columbia University is resisting Trump administration's demands, asserting its independence amid discussions on antisemitism and federal funding. The university opposes prescriptive requests regarding governance and presidential searches. This stance follows Harvard's loss of funding for non-compliance.

title: Flight attendant on ventilator support 'sexually assaulted' at Gurgaon hospital
content: A trainee flight attendant has filed a police complaint in Gurgaon, alleging sexual assault by a ward staffer at Medanta Hospital while she was on ventilator support. The woman, recovering from a near-drowning incident, claims the assault occurred while she was in a semi-conscious state. Police have initiated an investigation, reviewing CCTV footage and recording the woman's statement, while the hospital is cooperating with authorities.

title: Malayalam actor Vincy Aloshious accuses co-actor of 'misbehaviour' on movie set
content: Malayalam actor Vincy Aloshious accused a co-actor of drug use and misbehaviour on a film set. In an Instagram video, she shared her experience, stating that the actor, under the influence, misbehaved and disrupted the shoot. She vowed not to work with drug users again, citing the toxic work environment.

title: ‘Dead body’ in MUV boot? Youths detained over reel drama in Navi Mumbai
content: Four youths were detained by Navi Mumbai police after creating a public scare with a shocking reel showing a human hand hanging out of a moving MUV's boot—sparking fears of a possible kidnapping or dead body. The incident occurred between Vashi and Sanpada railway stations and was captured by a motorist who shared it on social media. Acting swiftly, police traced the vehicle to a mall within two hours and detained the youths involved.

title: NTA responds to student concerns over inaccurate JEE Mains 2025 answer key
content: National Testing Agency responded to concerns about errors in JEE Main 2025 Session 2 answer keys. Students reported incorrect answers and recording issues. NTA assures thorough review of all objections. Final results will be based on the verified answer key. The agency advises students to rely only on official information. Results are expected on April 17, 2025.

title: '20 million illegal aliens' overwhelmed America: Vance slams Biden
content: Vice President JD Vance strongly criticized Joe Biden's immigration policies, claiming they led to approximately 20 million undocumented migrants entering the US, straining resources and increasing crime. Vance asserted the Trump administration has successfully curbed illegal immigration and emphasized the need for mass deportations, dismissing due process concerns as obstructionist tactics.

title: Doctors are urging BP patients to have 1 banana daily: 5 reasons to have this superfruit
content: Doctors recommend daily banana consumption for individuals with high blood pressure due to their rich potassium content, which helps balance sodium levels and lower blood pressure. Bananas also provide soluble fiber, benefiting heart health by reducing cholesterol and stabilizing blood sugar. Additionally, they contain magnesium, promoting relaxed blood vessels and aiding in reducing water retention and bloating.

title: Trump issues new threat after Harvard University defies US govt demands
content: US President Donald Trump has threatened to revoke Harvard University's tax-exempt status, escalating his administration’s standoff with the nation’s oldest and wealthiest university. The threat follows Harvard’s rejection of federal demands to alter its hiring, admissions, and academic policies. Just a day prior, the administration froze more than $2 billion in federal funding to the university.

title: The switch hit: Tristan Stubbs’ journey from hockey to cricket
content: Tristan Stubbs, the explosive cricketer, initially honed his skills in hockey, following his father's passion. Chris Stubbs, a former provincial hockey player, steered Tristan towards cricket due to its greater career prospects. Tristan's hockey background significantly contributed to his cricketing prowess, particularly his powerful sweep shots and hand-eye coordination, shaping him into a formidable batsman.

title: At 5.4%, China's Q1 GDP growth beats expectations: 10 key takeaways
content: China's Q1 2025 GDP growth exceeded expectations at 5.4%, fueled by strong industrial output and retail sales. However, this boost is likely temporary as newly imposed US tariffs threaten to stall exports and overall economic momentum. Analysts anticipate a slowdown and have downgraded growth forecasts, urging policymakers to implement further stimulus measures to mitigate the impact.

title: 2 Maoists killed in encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh
content: Security forces neutralized two high-ranking Maoists, Haldar and Rame, in an encounter in the forests of Kondagaon-Narayanpur districts. The Maoists, carrying a combined reward of Rs 13 lakh, were killed during a search operation based on intelligence inputs. An AK-47 rifle, explosives, and Maoist materials were recovered from the site, marking a significant setback for Maoist operations in the region.

title: Saregama, Jio Fin & Power Grid: Check stock recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers' Mehul Kothari suggests buying Saregama and Jio Financial Services, citing bullish patterns and breakouts. Saregama shows strength above its 200 DEMA with an inverse head and shoulder pattern. Conversely, Power Grid is a sell due to exhaustion and resistance near its 200 DEMA, coupled with negative RSI divergence, indicating potential profit booking.

title: Amid Centre run-ins, Tamil Nadu sets up panel to 'shield' states' rights
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin has formed a high-level committee, led by retired Justice Kurian Joseph, to address concerns about state autonomy and federalism. The committee will recommend measures to protect states' rights and improve Centre-state relations, with reports expected in the coming years.

title: SC frowns upon HC judge's 'rape survivor invited trouble' remark
content: The Supreme Court has expressed disappointment over casual remarks made by Allahabad High Court judges, including one who blamed a rape victim for the assault. This follows previous concerns raised by the apex court regarding controversial orders and observations from the Allahabad High Court. The Supreme Court bench emphasized the need for judges to exercise caution when making such statements.

title: 3 workers killed as storage unit for pulses fall on them at mill in Yavatmal
content: Three workers were killed in the incident. Two other workers suffered injuries and were undergoing treatment in a hospital, says the official.

title: UDF calls for hartal in Athirappilly on April 16  after 3 tribals killed in elephant attacks
content: As Kerala records 18 deaths in wildlife attacks in 2025 alone, UDF slams govt inaction; demands urgent protection measures for residents in forest fringes

title: Panic takes over Patamata after ‘rape and murder’ of woman in broad daylight
content: Residents and traders urge officers to enhance security and check the consumption of alcohol on the roads in Auto Nagar area

title: Two Maoists killed in encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh
content: The gunfight took place on Tuesday evening in a forest of Kilam-Bargum villages along the border of Kondagaon and Narayanpur districts when a joint team of security personnel was out on an anti-Naxalite operation

title: Beach kabaddi, water sports slated for Manginipudi beach fest
content: Chief Minister, Deputy Chief Minister, MLAs and other prominent personalities likely to attend the beach festival, says official

title: Are births and deaths being properly registered in India? | Explained
content: What does the Registration of Birth and Death Act, 1969 mandate? What does the latest circular from the Registrar General of India state? Do private hospitals have the authority to register births and deaths on their own? When was the last Vital Statistics Report for India published?

title: Why are ASHA workers protesting in Kerala? | Explained
content: What is the payment structure of Accredited Social Health Activists in Kerala? Does it meet minimum wage?

title: Supreme Court to hear pleas against Waqf Amendment Act on April 16; six BJP-ruled States move court to support the law
content: A three-judge bench comprising Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna and Justices Sanjay Kumar and K.V. Viswanathan, so far, listed 10 petitions on the issue

title: Delhi govt raises minimum wages for skilled and unskilled workers
content: As per the revised worker wages, the monthly wage of unskilled workers will now be ₹18,456, while workers with graduation and above qualifications will get ₹24,356 per month

title: Bengal govt must stop attacks on Hindus over Waqf Act protests: VHP
content: Instead of issuing such statements, the government must ensure that the violence stops, security and compensation are given (to the victims), and attackers and instigators booked for atrocities on Hindus, says Milind Parande

title: Karnataka Gig Workers Bill: What stayed and what changed
content: Karnataka Platform-based Gig Workers (Social Security and Welfare) Bill, 2024, if passed, would make the State the second in the country to introduce a legislation for the welfare of platform-based gig workers after Rajasthan.

title: Andhra Pradesh will emerge as an aviation hub, says Minister Janardhan Reddy
content: Many industry leaders have expressed willingness to invest heavily in aviation-related projects in the State, says Janardhan Reddy

title: A.P. Home Minister accuses YSRCP of inciting religious tensions in State
content: The YSRCP tried to provoke religious tensions by spreading misinformation on the death of Hyderabad-based Pastor in Rajamahendravaram, says Anitha

title: Complete autonomy for States will weaken country, says BJP
content: Nagenthran said the demand for complete autonomy for States would weaken the country and instead the issue could be resolved in platforms

title: HRD Minister Lokesh pats Inter exam toppers for ‘upholding dignity of public education’
content: 52 State-level toppers in Intermediate exams from government junior colleges were felicitated at ‘Shining Stars-2025’

title: Some men face abuse but can't alter law protecting women: SC
content: The Supreme Court acknowledged potential misuse of dowry harassment laws (Section 498A IPC/Section 85 BNS) against men and their families, but refused to alter the legislation designed to protect women from cruelty in matrimonial settings. The court emphasized that isolated instances of misuse do not negate the widespread harassment faced by women, and each case must be evaluated individually.

title: 'Good Bad Ugly' box office collection day 6: Ajith starrer mints Rs 107.80 cr
content: Ajith Kumar's 'Good Bad Ugly' continues its successful box office run, earning an estimated Rs 6.50 crore on its sixth day, bringing the total India collection to approximately Rs 107.80 crore. The film opened strongly, particularly in Tamil Nadu, and maintained solid occupancy rates, showcasing Ajith Kumar's performance and the film's layered storytelling.

title: Pentagon leak probe: Pete Hegseth’s top adviser Dan Caldwell placed on leave
content: Dan Caldwell, a senior adviser to US defense secretary Pete Hegseth, has been placed on administrative leave following an investigation into leaks at the Department of Defense. Caldwell was identified as the source of an "unauthorized disclosure" involving sensitive communications and national security information. The investigation is ongoing, separate from recent firings within the department since Hegseth assumed leadership.

title: IMD predicts ‘above normal’ rainfall in India this monsoon
content: India is expected to receive above-normal southwest monsoon rainfall this year, according to the IMD's forecast. This is crucial for agriculture, boosting Kharif crops and the rural economy. While some regions may experience below-normal rainfall, most of the country, including the monsoon core zone, is likely to receive ample precipitation, potentially exceeding 91 cm.

title: Yuzvendra Chahal battles shoulder injury to help PBKS beat KKR
content: Punjab Kings pulled off a stunning victory against Kolkata Knight Riders in Mullanpur, defending a low score of 111. KKR's chase faltered dramatically thanks to Yuzvendra Chahal's game-changing spell of 4 for 28. Despite an early partnership by PBKS openers, KKR bowlers Harshit Rana, Varun Chakravarthy, and Sunil Narine restricted them.

title: J&K court issues proclaimed offender notice against Hizbul chief
content: A court in Budgam, J&K, has ordered Hizbul Mujahideen chief Syed Salahuddin to appear within a month regarding a 2002 murder and arms case. Failing to comply, proceedings will commence to declare him a proclaimed offender. The court noted that Salahuddin is reportedly residing in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, making his arrest impossible, and ordered public notification of the proclamation.

title: Bihar elections: RJD, Congress kick off talks over seats, campaigning
content: Congress and RJD have initiated discussions to finalize their electoral alliance for the Bihar polls, aiming to establish a timeline for seat-sharing and campaign strategies. Concerns over delays in seat allocation were addressed, with both parties prioritizing coordinated electioneering. They are expected to finalize seat-sharing by May-end, focusing on realistic demands and quality of seats.

title: 'Jaat' box office collection: Film crosses Rs 50 crore after decent Tuesday
content: Sunny Deol's action film 'Jaat,' also starring Randeep Hooda and Vineet Kumar Singh, is performing well at the box office, crossing ₹50 crore in six days. The film saw a jump over the weekend, particularly dominating in Rajasthan, UP, and Haryana due to its community connection.

title: Awkward moment: Sauce Gardner dodges kiss cam during public outing
content: Rapper Ice Spice and NFL star Sauce Gardner's rumored romance hit a snag at a UFC event when they awkwardly avoided a kiss cam moment, sparking widespread speculation. UFC President Dana White criticized their missed opportunity. Fans debated whether Gardner was shy or if the avoidance signaled a lack of genuine romance, contrasting them with more openly affectionate celebrity couples.

title: Amid spectre of violence, a muted New Year in Murshidabad
content: In Murshidabad, Bengal, the traditional Poila Baisakh celebrations were subdued following recent violence. While some traders like Nemai Ghosh and Dilip Sarkar bravely reopened their shops, facing anxieties and diminished sales, many residents returned to damaged homes.

title: Karnataka caste survey: Vokkaligas and Lingayats go into a huddle
content: Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar chaired a meeting of Vokkaliga Ministers and legislators, mostly from the Congress, in the evening to formulate a response

title: Are you using caste census report to prevent DKS from becoming CM, BJP asks Siddaramaiah
content: Leader of Opposition in the Assembly R. Ashok alleged that the Congress leaders themselves were of the view that the caste census report was being taken up to put Mr. Shivakumar in a tight spot

title: NITI Aayog sees bright future for India in power and hand tools export
content: The report noted that there is a transformative potential of hand and power tools industry for the country’s economic growth

title: Air hostess on ventilator in Gurugram hospital sexually assaulted by staff: Police
content: The Gurugram Police said the victim’s statement was recorded before the Magistrate and the matter was under investigation

title: Telangana prepares for ‘warming planet’ with higher ex-gratia, district-wise heatwave plan
content: Officially recognises heatwave as a ‘State-specific disaster’ and raised ex-gratia amount for victims’ families to ₹4 lakh

title: University of Hyderabad team basks in glory as LHC wins Breakthrough Prize
content: The team contributed to the Compact Muon Solenoid experiment at CERN through data analysis, trigger electronics, and research in high-energy particle interactions

title: Gandhi Hospital doctors remove screwdriver lodged in man’s brain
content: Investigations revealed that the object had pierced the frontal bone and entered the brain, making it a life-threatening injury

title: Congress playing ‘victim card’ after looting money: BJP
content: The ED's chargesheet has made it clear how the Gandhi family did money laundering in the case, says BJP MP and chief spokesperson Anil Baluni

title: Travellers seek regular police patrolling at new bus terminus in Vellore
content: According to norms, ten police personnel should be deployed at the facility every day on a shift basis; travellers, however, say that the existing outpost does not have adequate personnel

title: Pakistan should look at its own abysmal record of protecting rights of minorities: India
content: MEA’s response comes after Pakistan’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs described the Waqf (Amendment) Act as an “infringement over the religious and economic rights of Indians Muslims”

title: Will see if Centre-State relations need glasnost and, if need be, perestroika: Justice Kurian Joseph
content: The former Supreme Court judge said the Constitution was an organic document that should live up to the aspirations of people for all times

title: Under nPROUD, 21 tonnes of unused or expired drugs from Kozhikode sent for disposal
content: Around 14 tonnes of unused or expired drugs collected from Kozhikode Corporation through line collection method, five tonnes through temporary collection, and five tonnes through household collection

title: Praja Arogya Vedika opposes privatisation of medical colleges
content: The poor will bear the brunt of the privatisation of medical colleges. The number of service-oriented doctors will decrease in this model as it would be all about business, said Praja Arogya Vedika State president K.V.S. Sai Prasad

title: Enthused by support of Bengalureans, KRRS plans to make farmer-to-consumer santhes a fortnightly feature
content: While the fortnightly santhe will be held on April 26-27, the earlier experimental santhe saw turnover of ₹20 lakh involving over 5,000 consumers

title: Top policymakers and global experts to speak on pressing issues at The Hindu Huddle
content: The theme for the Huddle, to be held in Bengaluru on May 9 and 10, is ‘India in Dialogue’; Amit Shah to deliver inaugural address

title: Extraditions tough till conditions improve in Indian prisons: Justice Madan B. Lokur
content: Justice Lokur points to U.K. court judgement denying an extradition, citing unsafe conditions in Tihar jail

title: Captive breeding comes to the rescue of Toda buffalo as its population plummets in Nilgiris
content: Officials say that the population ranged from 15,000 to 20,000 across the district a few decades ago. But a 2023 enumeration of the buffaloes in all Toda hamlets revealed that less than 1,000 animals were left. Hence, the Sheep Breeding Research Station at Sandynallah has begun a programme to help the population re-establish itself in the hills

title: How Rajinikanth’s speech impacted the political journey of AIADMK veteran R.M. Veerappan
content: On July 14, 1995, at an event to celebrate the 100-day run of Baasha, which came out under the banner of R.M. Veerappan’s Sathya Movies, Rajinikanth was critical of the “spread of bomb culture” in Tamil Nadu. Chief Minister Jayalalithaa was upset that the Minister did not deny the charge. Veerappan’s fall from power started then

title: ‘Bengal rioters given free run,’ alleges Yogi in attack on Mamata
content: Law and order has now been fully restored in Uttar Pradesh, because we know that rioters understand only one language, the language of the lathi

title: Singareni to commence coal production in Naini Block of Odisha 9 years after allotment
content: Deputy CM Bhatti Vikramarka to launch the mine virtually today; the mine has over 340 million tonnes of coal reserves, likely to last for 38 years

title: Muthalapozhi fishers restive over the slow progress in desilting the harbour mouth
content: Fisheries Minister Saji Cherian has called a meeting of stakeholders to mitigate the threat to fishers. The fishers want more dredgers to triple the quantum of sand removed daily by the company contracted by the government to desilt the harbour mouth

title: BJP MLA’s son, eight others booked for entering temple forcibly, thrashing priest in Madhya Pradesh
content: The FIR was filed on Monday against one person; BJP MLA Golu Shukla’s son Rudraksh Shukla and seven others were named in the FIR on Tuesday

title: Supply chain feels the ripple effect of truck strike on day one
content: While essential services like milk supply have been exempted, trucks carrying vegetables, LPG cylinders, construction materials, and industrial goods stayed off the roads

title: Murshidabad remains calm, arrests climb to 230 in West Bengal
content: Amid the prevailing tensions and mounting arrests, residents of the affected areas demand permanent deployment of Central Armed Police Forces.

title: SC notice to Centre on Kerala man’s cremation by Delhi Police as kin searched for him
content: Plea sought guidelines to ensure that effective steps, including mandatory implementation of digital and biometric identification of unidentified bodies, are in place so that traumatised families could be spared such incidents in future

title: IIT, NIT placement data show job market stagnation: Congress
content: If one-fifth of the engineers at IITs are unable to find jobs, it raises concern over how the larger population of educated youth in this country is able to secure employment, says Jairam Ramesh

title: Ruling front and Opposition seek to undermine BJP’s dalliance with Church leadership over Munambam
content: LDF and UDF seek to capitalise on Union Minister Kiren Rijiju’s statement that the Waqf Act 2025 offered no sure-fire solution to  residents of Munambam locked in property ownership dispute with  Waqf Board

title: MUDA case: Special court defers decision on ‘B’ report filed by Lokayukta police giving clean chit to CM Siddaramaiah and wife
content: It allows further probe to fix responsibility on former MUDA commissioners for causing loss to exchequer by illegal allotment of sites, including 14 sites allotted CM’s wife

title: Shibu Soren appoints son and Jharkhand CM Hemant JMM chief; BJP criticises family politics
content: My father established the party as a regional movement, and now it is my responsibility to take it to the national level, says Hemant Soren

title: It has become a practice for GHMC to permit illegal structures, then regularise them: Justice C.V. Bhaskar Reddy
content: The judge directed both the GHMC Commissioner and HMDA Commissioner to appear before the Bench personally if they fail to furnish the report by July 2

title: Bodies of two teens retrieved from Godavari river at Dowleswaram barrage
content: Prakash Kumar and Harsha drowned at Vijjeswaram while bathing; bodies found after delayed search in deep waters

title: Warriors outlast Grizzlies to lock up playoff berth
content: Jimmy Butler and Stephen Curry led the Warriors over the Grizzlies on Tuesday night in the play-in tournament and to the seventh seed in the West.

title: Anthony carries Magic past Hawks into playoffs
content: Cole Anthony scored 26 points off the bench to help the Magic beat the Hawks on Tuesday and set up a first-round series versus the Celtics.

title: Trae tossed for 'making mockery of game' in loss
content: Addressing his ejection, Trae Young said he was taking out his frustration on the officials for giving his team what he thought was a bad whistle.

title: Hunter says game over if he can't play both ways
content: If an NFL team told Travis Hunter he had to focus on wide receiver or cornerback and not play both, it would be game over for him, he told CBS Sports.

title: Coach: Silent treatment by Rory part of the 'plan'
content: Rory McIlroy stuck to a strategy of staying laser-focused, even if that meant not saying a word to Bryson DeChambeau during the final round of the Masters.

title: Wild's Fleury plays 'game I love' one more time
content: Minnesota coach John Hynes sent retiring goaltender Marc-Andre Fleury, 40, out for overtime in what could well be the final game of his storied career, and the Wild outlasted the Anaheim Ducks 3-2 on Tuesday night in the home team's regular-season finale.

title: Coveted former Cal RB Ott transferring to OU
content: Jaydn Ott, one of the top playmakers coming back in college football, is moving on to Oklahoma, just one day after entering the transfer portal.

title: WTA's Dart rues requesting foe 'put on deodorant'
content: Harriet Dart apologized after her 6-0, 6-3 loss at the Rouen Open on Tuesday for saying that her opponent, Lois Boisson, "smells really bad."

title: How Tennessee coach Josh Heupel scored one for coaches everywhere
content: By refusing quarterback Nico Iamaleava's NIL demand, Heupel and Tennessee took a stand for the good of the program.

title: NBA experts' picks for the remaining play-in showdowns
content: Our experts pick which teams make it out of the play-in tournament and which will survive the first round.

title: From A-plus Wings to C-minus Valkyries, grading every team's WNBA draft performance
content: Dallas, with Paige Bueckers at No. 1, and Washington, which got Sonia Citron at No. 3, got high marks in the WNBA draft.

title: Rickea Jackson jokes about not being dunked on by Storm rookie Dominque Malonga
content: Sydney Colson, on the other hand, would love to see Rickea Jackson end up on a Dominque Malonga poster.

title: Why Luis Robert Jr. could be MLB trade deadline's most sought-after slugger
content: He had a disastrous 2024, but if Robert can play to his potential, the phones in Chicago will be ringing off the hook.

title: Meet the Wild's secret weapon -- who won't play a single minute this season
content: With a roster tight against the salary cap, the club has needed to make the most of its roster spots.

title: What comes next for the flailing Phoenix Suns -- and Kevin Durant
content: After firing their third coach in three years, the Suns' next -- and perhaps only -- move is trading Kevin Durant.

title: Rashford proved he's still big-time at Villa, but PSG the superior Champions League side
content: Aston Villa showed fight, but PSG have too much going for them and are as poised as anyone for Champions League greatness.

title: Barça should have cruised by Dortmund, but they nearly crumbled
content: Flashbacks of past capitulations were fresh in the mind as Barcelona nearly contrived to give up a four-goal lead.

title: College baseball's next big thing: Rintaro Sasaki
content: Rintaro Sasaki chose to play for Stanford over going pro in Japan, so what exactly brought him to college baseball?

title: Winners and losers from the Masters, plus predictions for the rest of this year's majors
content: From Rory McIlroy to early favorites for the final three majors of the golf season, we look at five big questions coming out of Augusta and looking forward to the rest of the 2025 season.

title: Women's college basketball transfer rankings: Fulwiley one of seven new players in top 25
content: South Carolina-bound Ta'Niya Latson tops the transfer rankings, but MiLaysia Fulwiley and Janiah Barker break into the top 10.

title: John Cena's most memorable WrestleMania matches
content: Before Cena dons the jorts a final time at WrestleMania, we look at 10 matches that have shaped his legacy.

title: Why defensive tackles are more important than ever in the NFL draft
content: DTs are getting paid big money, and the 2025 draft class is loaded. Will the draft reflect this is an elite position?

title: 30 years on, will Ki-Jana Carter be emulated by Ashton Jeanty?
content: Running backs are the strongest position group in this draft class. But will one get picked first ever again?

title: Our latest college softball poll: How do the top teams stack up after Week 10?
content: How far did the Longhorns and Sooners fall? Check out our latest college softball Top 25 poll, plus play of the week

title: Priyanka Gandhi Drops Off Robert Vadra On Day 2 At Probe Agency ED Office
content: Accompanied by his wife and Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Robert Vadra reached the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office for the second consecutive day in the Gurugram land case.

title: Patient Dragged, Beaten With Sticks: Karnataka Rehab Centre Visuals Spark Outrage
content: A patient was dragged and brutally assaulted at a rehabilitation centre near Bengaluru, prompting outrage and the subsequent arrest of the perpetrators.

title: US Judge Stops Trump Administration From Cancelling Indian Student's Visa
content: A US federal judge has barred the Trump administration from deporting a 21-year-old Indian whose student visa was cancelled just weeks before he was set to graduate.

title: Man Saw YouTuber Wife In Intimate Act With Lover, They Choked Him To Death
content: Social media influencers Ravina and Suresh connected on Instagram one and a half years ago and were soon making videos together. Ravina and her husband Praveen would often argue over her social media addiction and he also suspected an affair

title: YouTuber Strangles Husband With Dupatta, Dumps Body With Lover's Help
content: Two lovers strangled the woman's husband to death in Haryana's Hisar district after they were caught in an objectionable position.

title: Donald Trump Wants Harvard University To "Apologise": White House
content: President Donald Trump escalated his war against elite US universities Tuesday with a threat to strip Harvard's tax-exempt status if the country's most famous educational establishment refuses to submit to wide-ranging government oversight.

title: Air Hostess Sexually Assaulted While On Ventilator In Gurugram Hospital: Cops
content: An air hostess alleged that she was sexually assaulted when she was on ventilator support in the intensive care unit (ICU) of a private hospital in Gurugram on April 6, police said.

title: Hamas Loses Contact With Hostage At Centre Of Latest Gaza Truce Offer
content: Hamas said Tuesday that after an Israeli strike it had "lost contact" with the captors of an Israeli-American hostage in Gaza, whose release reportedly takes centre stage in Israel's latest proposal for a renewed ceasefire.

title: NASA's Webb Telescope Releases Clearest Pictures Of Dying Stars
content: NASA has released some stunning images of dying stars, offering the most in-depth view of the planetary nebula NGC 1514 to date.

title: Can We Send Her Back? Wendy's Mocks Katy Perry After Blue Origin Flight
content: An American fast food chain has taken a jab at pop star Katy Perry after her return from Blue Origins all-female space mission on April 14.

title: US State Department Plans Budget Cut By Almost 50%
content: The US State Department is expected to propose an unprecedented dismantling of Washington's diplomatic reach, multiple news outlets reported Tuesday, shuttering programs and embassies worldwide to slash the budget by almost 50 percent.

title: Bahamas Suspends SpaceX Rocket Landings Pending Post-Launch Probe
content: The Bahamas' government said on Tuesday it is suspending all SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket landings in the country, pending a full post-launch investigation.

title: Thousands of games, one-of-a-kind scores: Inside NBA 'scorigami'
content: Fueled by fast-paced play and unique scorelines, NBA scorigami has carved out a niche corner of basketball fandom.

title: Flick has to remind glum Barça: We're in semis
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick said he had to remind his disappointed players they had reached the Champions League semifinal after Tuesday's 3-1 loss to Borussia Dortmund.

title: Rashford's future undecided after Villa UCL exit
content: Unai Emery said the future of on-loan Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford "depends on the next weeks."

title: Luis Enrique: Semi-bound PSG world's 'best squad'
content: Paris Saint-Germain coach Luis Enrique hailed his squad as the best in the world on Tuesday after they reached the Champions League semifinals with a 5-4 aggregate win over Aston Villa.

title: Mbappé escapes with 1-game ban for violent tackle
content: Kylian Mbappé received with a one-game suspension after being shown a red card for a violent tackle against Alaves on Sunday, the Spanish Football Federation (RFEF) announced Tuesday.

title: Bellingham: QF 2nd leg 'a night made for Madrid'
content: Jude Bellingham has said Wednesday's Champions League quarterfinal second leg against Arsenal is "a night made for Real Madrid."

title: Inter deny premature celebrations after Kane barb
content: Inter Milan midfielder Henrikh Mkhitaryan denied his team had over-celebrated after beating Bayern Munich in the first leg of their Champions League quarterfinal.

title: 'Urban warfare': Rome mayor slams derby clashes
content: The toll from clashes between violent fans and police at the weekend's Rome derby includes 24 law enforcement officers injured, one arrest and at least $45,000 in damaged garbage dumpsters.

title: Arteta: Arsenal must ignore Real comeback noise
content: Mikel Arteta has urged Arsenal to shut out expectations of another famous Real Madrid comeback and "talk on the pitch" in Wednesday's Champions League quarterfinal showdown.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal join Chelsea in race for Barcelona's Koundé
content: Arsenal are ready to fight Chelsea to sign Jules Koundé from Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news and gossip.

title: From 'Ted Lasso' appearances to honest talks about being fired: Inside Pete Carroll's USC class
content: This spring, in addition to being named head coach of the Las Vegas Raiders, Carroll has been moonlighting as a college professor.

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Who earned a spot, Volkanovski or Jandiroba?
content: There's a new featherweight champion and new strawweight No. 1 contender -- but just one is in ESPN's top 10.

title: Who will new featherweight champ Volkanovski fight in first defense?
content: Should Alexander Volkanovski get Movsar Evloev? Is Paddy Pimblett-Charles Oliveira a real possibility?

title: Did Lewis Hamilton have a breakthrough with Ferrari in Bahrain?
content: Lewis Hamilton has struggled to adapt to his new home at Ferrari, but he might have turned a corner in Bahrain.

title: La Bolita, Cuban Lottery Offering Hope In Tough Times
content: Every day, as he has done for 20 years, Carlos makes the rounds collecting bets in central Havana for "la bolita" -- a clandestine national lottery that provides a sliver of hope for Cubans struggling to make ends meet.

title: 'Toxic Beauty': Rise Of 'Looksmaxxing' Influencers
content: Hankering for a chiseled jawline, a male TikTok influencer strikes his cheekbones with a hammer -- highlighting the rise of "looksmaxxing," an online trend pushing unproven and sometimes dangerous techniques to boost sexual appeal.

title: IDF Jet Bombs Israeli Community Along Gaza Border, Blames "Malfunction"
content: An Israeli Air Force fighter jet dropped a bomb near an Israeli community on the Gaza border owing to a "technical malfunction".

title: Top US Defense Secretary Put On Leave In Pentagon Leak Probe
content: One of US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth's leading advisers, Dan Caldwell, was escorted from the Pentagon on Tuesday after being identified during an investigation into leaks at the Department of Defense, a US official told Reuters.

title: Challenges To Waqf Law To Be Heard By Supreme Court Today: 10 Points
content: A bunch of petitions challenging the amended Waqf law -- meant to govern how Muslim charitable properties are managed -- will be heard by the Supreme Court today. Six BJP-ruled states that intend to defend the law, have sought to join in.

title: Facebook Added "Value" To Instagram: Mark Zuckerberg At US Antitrust Trial
content: Social media titan Mark Zuckerberg testified for a second day Tuesday in a landmark US antitrust trial, defending his conglomerate Meta against accusations it took over Instagram and WhatsApp to devour budding competitors.

title: "Language Not Religion": Top Court Rejects Plea Against Urdu On Signboard
content: Language is not religion and to consider Urdu as a language of Muslims is a "pitiable digression" from reality and unity in diversity, the Supreme Court has said while rejecting a petition challenging use of Urdu on the nameboard of municipal council
